1.text: Every wise woman builds her house, but a foolish one tears it down with her own hands.

2.text: He who walks in uprightness fears the LORD, but the one who is devious in his ways despises Him.

3.text: The proud speech of a fool brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.

4.text: Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty, but an abundant harvest comes through the strength of the ox.

5.text: An honest witness does not deceive, but a dishonest witness pours forth lies.

6.text: A mocker seeks wisdom and finds none, but knowledge comes easily to the discerning.

7.text: Stay away from a foolish man; you will gain no knowledge from his speech.

8.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way, but the folly of fools deceives them.

9.text: Fools mock the making of amends, but goodwill is found among the upright.

10.text: The heart knows its own bitterness, and no stranger shares in its joy.

11.text: The house of the wicked will be destroyed, but the tent of the upright will flourish.

12.text: There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way of death.

13.text: Even in laughter the heart may ache, and joy may end in sorrow.

14.text: The backslider in heart receives the fill of his own ways, but a good man is rewarded for his ways.

15.text: The simple man believes every word, but the prudent man watches his steps.

16.text: A wise man fears and turns from evil, but a fool is careless and reckless.

17.text: A quick-tempered man acts foolishly, and a devious man is hated.

18.text: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.text: The evil bow before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

20.text: The poor man is hated even by his neighbor, but many are those who love the rich.

21.text: He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who shows kindness to the poor.

22.text: Do not those who contrive evil go astray? But those who plan goodness find loving devotion and faithfulness.

23.text: There is profit in all labor, but mere talk leads only to poverty.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their wealth, but the effort of fools is folly.

25.text: A truthful witness saves lives, but one who utters lies is deceitful.

26.text: He who fears the LORD is secure in confidence, and his children shall have a place of refuge.

27.text: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death.

28.text: A large population is a king’s splendor, but a lack of subjects is a prince’s ruin.

29.text: A patient man has great understanding, but a quick-tempered man promotes folly.

30.text: A tranquil heart is life to the body, but envy rots the bones.

31.text: Whoever oppresses the poor taunts their Maker, but whoever is kind to the needy honors Him.

32.text: The wicked man is thrown down by his own sin, but the righteous man has a refuge even in death.

33.text: Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning; even among fools she is known.

34.text: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.

35.text: A king delights in a wise servant, but his anger falls on the shameful.
